headline: Rolling Sod
caption: We've laid out and started removing sod for two 70' x 100' fields.  So excited to break ground!

headline: Amending the Soil
caption: Amending and tilling the soil in the new flower fields.

headline: Penny in the Field
caption: Penny Lane is out in the field helping us on the new farm.  I love her.  She never leaves my side.

headline: Amending the Soil
caption: Amending and tilling the soil in the new flower fields.

headline: Tilling the Field
caption: Our first attempt at tilling the fields.  Would've been easier with air in both tires.

headline: Planning
caption: Deciding what to plant when is the hardest job ever.  I'd really rather be digging in the field.

headline: What to Plant When
caption: Deciding what to plant when is the hardest job ever.  I'd really rather be digging in the field.

headline: Preparing the Soil
caption: Trying out a few different soils to start seeds.  We'll see which sprout first.

headline: Our First Seeds
caption: Sowing our first seeds in the basements.  Hoping for the best.

headline: First Photo Shoot
caption: We don't even have flowers yet so we had to purchase flowers for our first photo shoot.

headline: Dahlia Tubers Arrived
caption: Our first order of Dahlia tubers arrived in the mail from Sunny Meadows.  Time to pack them for storage.  Can't wait to get them in the ground.

headline: Sweet Pea Sprouts
caption: The Sweet Pea's have sprouted and they're ready for pinching.

headline: Preparing the Landscape Fabric
caption: Rolling out and burning nearly 1000 feet of landscape fabric with 9 inch spacing.  Unfortunately, it was raining today so we had to do it in the barn.

headline: Spring Chicks Have Arrived
caption: Nine new chicks came from Meyer Hatchery: 2 Black Split to Lavender Orpinton, 2 Cream Legbar, 2 Lavendar Orpington, 2 Swedish Flower Hen, and 1 mystery chicken.
